website_summaries.verdict: The most versatile-size slow cooker with the convenience of programmable cooking times and a locking lid for transport.
pros: Set cooking time from 30 minutes to 20 hours: when time is up, the Crock-Pot automatically switches to "Warm" setting
Oversize handles and locking lid make the slow cooker easy to transport to potlucks and more
cons: A few owners complained that the pot cooked too hot and too fast
A handful of owners claimed the pot developed hairline cracks soon after purchase

website_summaries.verdict: Although not the cheapest unit, this affordable cooker renders a very good result. Rated #2 in our kitchen test.
pros: Digital controls for timer and temperature
Can cook for up to seven people
cons: Keep Warm" setting is high enough to continue cooking food

customer_reviews.title: Hope this works well - terrible job shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these and just needed an additional one, so I know these crockpots work great; however, I'm deducting 2 stars because the Amazon smile box was crushed and had no padding inside it even though there was plenty of room around the product container, making me worry that the heating element in the crockpot may have gotten damaged in transit. Also, the rubber seal around the lid was warped in several places so I'm not sure it will seal properly to be water-tight when it is locked on. I already tried to post one review with pictures showing all the damage, but it was rejected - what's wrong Amazon? Don't want accuracy in your reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Maria Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is way off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this crock pot to replace a Hamilton slow cooker that I had for almost 10 years. I just wanted something stainless steel that looked nicer, but I wish I would have just kept my Hamilton slow cooker that actually worked. The "keep warm" function is actually hotter than the "low" function, and could even be hotter than the high temperature. It's waaay off. The low function also cooks way too hot, a 4lb pot roast cooked on "low" in less than 4 hours, when it should have been 6-8. The edges were burned black and it was completely dried out. I thought crock pot would be a reliable brand, turns out I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amy J

customer_reviews.title: I loved my old crockpot so I was very surprised to ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my old crockpot so I was very surprised to get this and hate it. I read the reviews of the pot runnin too hot but I’m having the exact opposite problem- this does not get my food done. I’ve always been able to put a roast in the crockpot and have it done in 8 hours. I e tried 5 different roasts in this one at least and none of them are getting done- even at 10 hours on low. Today I put one in on high since I’m home all day and 5 hours in and it’s not even close to being tender. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ANW

customer_reviews.title: I broke the lid. I tried to order another ...
customer_reviews.text: I broke the lid. I tried to order another lid. Crock Pot company said it was not available at this time. I read a review that said that a replacement lid was still not available after two years. So to all who want to buy this product...you may wish to take my experience into consideration prior to your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Try another crockpot.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my wife. She has used it less than five times since then. Today she goes to lock the lid and the clamp snapped off the lid. Poor constructions of this product. The clamps feel very cheap and are only held on by a pin and clip. This is very disappointing that a name brand product that is not cheap broke so easily and soon after purchase. If I could give it 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Heats ok - electronic gaps though
customer_reviews.text: The crock heats fine - but high and low are the same temp and when I try to change any settings once the unit is running the control panel freezes and I have to go to great lengths (reset process) to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you plan to leave it cooking all day
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace a slow cooker I had for years, and this Crock Pot is no replacement. It boils even on high, low and warm. There is no way I can place food in it then leave for work. It is boiling after just a couple of hours. Kind of defeats the purpose of a slow cooker. And Crock Pot won't do anything about it. Told me that yes it can boil at all temps and I must be using old crock pot recipes. WHAT??? How can a recipes age make it boil or not?? VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware not 6 quart as stated
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a 6 quart crockpot. It didn’t look like a 6 quart so I decided to measure the capacity using Quart measuring cup. It didn’t even measure 4 1/2 quarts. Was barely a hair over 4 quarts. Shown on Amazon, on order and on the box as 6 quarts. IS NOT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too hot.
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with this crock pot since June 2016 when I purchased it. It cooks way too quickly. I have had to adjust cooking time on every thing or it just overcooks . Low should really be high. I used to use my crock pot at least one a week. Now I hesitate to make anything and never for company since I don't know how my food will turn out. I also do not like the rubber seal on the lid. It is hard to clean. I am about ready to give up and replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used Crock-Pot
customer_reviews.text: Just opened my Crock-Pot and it is clearly used. There is dried food on the inside of the Crock-Pot heating area and there are scratches all over the thing. This is my second Crock-Pot from them as the other one over heated the food! I definitely didn't pay for a used Crock-Pot and I'm truly unhappy. I'm going to give it a try just because I'm in need of this Crock-Pot, but it very well may be going back as well. Off to go give it a deep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Camilla L. Britt

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, but could use tweaks to stabilize it
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase of this product. One purchase at a brick and mortar store. The first one worked for a couple of years and then quit. I use it quite a lot though. The second works fine, but the temperature does not heat evenly. It gets substantially hotter on one lower end than the other. It also gets super hot once the timer nears expiration. I don't know if that's a glitch or the way it is designed. Even so, I purchased a third because it does perform well overall. My biggest gripe is how unsteady it is with only three feet to stabilize it on the bottom. It is easy to tip if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Cocktail Nerd

customer_reviews.title: I don't really like the lid
customer_reviews.text: This crock pot has served me well the last year or so, however there is one small issue. I don't really like the lid. Those snaps at either side? They're held in with cheap plastic that looks almost like a rivet at the bottom of the lid. Those broke quickly, and now those snaps twirl around and there are additional little holes through which moisture pass. A solid glass lid without those snaps at either end would make this an excellent product with a fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered is obviously not new - it appears to have been hand washed and not fully dry before boxing. Had an immediate need for it, so won’t be returning. Also, the unit is not insulated well at all. The outside gets so hot. The crockpot I had to replace, you couldn’t feel heat from the outside at all. The lid is very thin and collected water under the handle when washed, and the lock is not tight. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something to seriously consider...not power interruption recovery!!  BAD!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where power flickers on/off sometimes even on sunny, no-wind days. Go figure, right? Well, if that should happen this crock pot will NOT resume where it left off. I returned this unit and went back to the old tried and true manual dial Crock Pot (the black, 8 qt unit) and used a Xmas light timer to make sure it shuts off when I want it to (just in-case I run late at the office). I like knowing that a brown-out is not going to cause my meal to stop cooking, and not having any digital display, electronics, or snaps for the lid means fewer things to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I like to wait at least 6 months before reviewing a product to truly test the durability. I love this crock pot. Easy to clean, durable, and easy to use. I have had it for 2 years and still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Millard M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Crockpot! This is so easy to use and convenient. I've even taken it to a Thanksgiving dinner and had no issues with spilling with the car ride. Only thing I wished is that there was an app where you could turn it on and control the settings from wherever you are since most recipes cook for 6 hrs or less and I'm usually at work for 8 or more. Yes, it will switch to warm, but depending on what your cooking and how it's laying in the pot, it could overcook. However, all my food has come out tasty and other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: SusieNY

customer_reviews.title: Complete Failure!
customer_reviews.text: I used this crock pot a dozen times. Then it completely failed. I was cooking a roast on low and had to keep wiping up fluid off the counter. The third time of wiping a mess, I unplugged the unit to investigate what was going on. I lifted the crock out and the bottom stayed fixed with the roast. I was shocked to lift the bottomless crock out. Dinner was ruined. The first photo shows what I lifted out of the unit, no bottom, no food. Be careful out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Too hot
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker on low operates at too high of a temperature. Cooked ribs, using a recipe I have used in the past. These ribs in the past always came out tender and juicy. This slow cooker destroyed them, they came out dry as a bone. Throwing this thing in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I got this item fee. In 10 years of being an Amazon member this is the first time I got an alert on my echo that a package had been delivered but when I went to grab it no box was there. I called Amazon and they sent me a replacement free. The unit does what is says and cook correctly. I love being able to fit a whole chicken in the unit. Not so sure about the lock unit. I do not plan to travel with the device. I also like the timer function something that my current crock pot did not have.
customer_reviews.author: IOU2

customer_reviews.title: After cleaning, after unpacking, wondered why the bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning, after unpacking, wondered why the bowl was so floppy in the base. The recipe we first tried called for low and slow cooking for 6-hours. I set it for low and came back 2-hours later to find it boiling hard, with a blackened ring. I checked with a temperature probe and it was 238 F. I switched it to warm and checked again 39-min later and it had cooled all the way down to 225 F, and 3o more minutes and it dropped to 205 F. I'll be returning the unit for a replacement and hopefully the next one will understand the actual meaning of "low."
customer_reviews.author: P. Howey

customer_reviews.title: Timer stopped working after 11 months.
customer_reviews.text: It was a good purchase, until the timer stopped working–after less than a year. Since I don't keep original boxes around forever, the warranty cannot be used. What a crock!
customer_reviews.author: kittylove

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I received this item as Christmas gift. After using it about 10 times, it decided to catch on fire and started melting. This is completely unacceptable! After doing further investigating, i see this is not the first time something like this has happened. Luckily i was home and smelled the burning. Had i still been at the gym, this could of ended terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz Clark

customer_reviews.title: No!
customer_reviews.text: This is a purchase I regret. It has high, low, and warm settings however I believe they are defective. If you set it on high and then turn it to low because of boiling, it will continue to boil at low. The same is the case for warm. So basically, mine only seems to operate at one setting. Also not impressed with the lid. The flexibility of the seal makes placing the lid back on more difficult, for lack of a better word, than it needs to be. Not to mention that I found that the sale price was not any different than I could have gotten if I had walked into my local grocery store. Very dissatisfied overall.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer2011

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this product. I place frozen chicken breasts in it before leaving for work, with a can of cream of mushroom soup and came home to cooked dinner. Love it and so does my family.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: Slides around in base! Not the same as previous models!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this same type of model for years but needed a new one. This is nothing like the older one. The stonewear insert slides around in the base and the handles to lift it out are now on the long sides rather than the short ends. Why change a good thing?
customer_reviews.author: Brellie

customer_reviews.title: I like this Crock-Pot but I hadn't had it 90 days ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this Crock-Pot but I hadn't had it 90 days before the latch that secures the lid to the pot broke. My son managed to fit it, but it's way too flimsy to be such an important component of the Crock-Pot.
customer_reviews.author: @drdijones

customer_reviews.title: Does not cook properly - even on high
customer_reviews.text: This thing doesn't get hot enough to function as a crock pot should. This is the third time I've tried to make something in it and it takes 18 hours on high to cook the simplest of things. Either I got an extreme lemon or this thing is complete crap. It's too late to get my money back because I just don't use it often but I can sure leave a review that matches the quality of my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace another brand after it got broken in a move. This one is much lighter and lots of plastic. The locks are plastic, the lid is glass but has skimpy, flimsy rubber gasket around the edges. I was skeptical on first use that it would even do the job but it did a great job cooking pork barbeque and after 8 hrs on low, switched right to warm which was nice. My vote is still out but so far, it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reconditioned?????
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid this slow cooker is okay. It looked great in the pictures and appeared to be okay when I was unwrapping it. Everything was new and shiney until I noticed food stuck to the inside of the cooker. What's up with that???? Apparently I purchased a reconditioned unit. I'm going to clean it up really well and live with it in place of returning for a refund. Even the crock seems to be too small and misfitting. It's just not worth the hassle of packing up and returning. It works and looks okay. If I'd looked at it in a store I would not have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: tomatolady

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I expected. the low is very low so you will want to go the absolute high end of cooking time. Very disappointed with the lid closure clip....only used this 3-4 times and the plastic that is essentially a button holding the plastic is very lose and not way to fix. The 3rd issue I have is the lid is plastic and I never seem after several washings in the sink with hot, clean, soapy water cannot eliminate the streaks that make it look dirty all of the time. I would not recommend and wish I had kept my old crockpot that was at least 15 yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this crockpot! I have loved crockpots for years. This gets way too hot. It’ll cook chicken breasts on low in about 2 hours. It continues to cook when on warm. I’m bummed about this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Too hot
customer_reviews.text: It seems mine is too hot. On high my corned beef was waaayyyy over cooked and I even shaved off an hour. On low my "creamy mexican chicken" was done 2 hours early (only cause I was checking the temp). Luckily I was at home during these two test runs. I suppose when I set it up for while I'm away I will shave off double the hours and let it stay on warm since many say the warming is also too hot. Oh well. Good enough I guess. At least the lid is tight enough that water doesnt evaporate, that was the problem with my last one.
customer_reviews.author: NannerTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: The product is a good size. I didn't realize programmable doesn't mean you ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is a good size. I didn't realize programmable doesn't mean you can delay the start - that was my fault for not reading closely enough. I gave it a low rating because the first time I used it, on the low setting, the entire outer silver panel was too hot to touch within an hour. I definitely would not feel comfortable leaving it alone or having it anywhere little fingers might brush against it. Really disappointed since its a Crock-Pot product, which is supposed to be synonymous with high quality slow cookers.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kent

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be More Shoddy
customer_reviews.text: Surprised that a well-known brand name is made so cheaply and designed so poorly. The cover clips on this item are VERY fragile and poorly attached to the lid. One failed on first use and Amazing Amazon cheerfully replaced it immediately. But I worry about the replacement holding up. Ditto for the vulnerable rubber gasket on the lid, which will shred in no time. The controls are super cheap and non-intuitive, and the body of the unit gets 2nd degree burn-hot. Can they not put a little insulation in these things? It would certainly make it safer and more energy efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Steve

customer_reviews.title: Poor lid construction.
customer_reviews.text: Good size if want large meal, just note it is VERY HEAVY (lifting to clean or changing serving location)...also lid LOCK says do NOT lock during cooking, so there is only a thin rubber seal on lower edget of top to make top rest lightly on pot, making even cooking on HIGH take allot longer than older crock pots I've had, that used to be 4 hrs. Even tho' veggies covered in broth, carrots hard to cook. I'm going back to older style crock pot and returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Strgzr7

customer_reviews.title: Still the best low cost Slow Cooker on the Market.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Crock Pot. The controls are simple and straight forward. The unit's materials and build quality are also excellent. I love the lockable lid which has come in very handy when taking a meal to a friend's house. And last but certainly not least, the cooking performance on both "Low" and "High" has been excellent to date. The one down side is that my unit's "Keep Warm" setting seems to run on the hot side. So attention should be given not to let your already finished dinner become overcooked by keeping the "Keep Warm" function on too long. But other than that, Crock Pot still makes the best low cost slow cooker on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tinelli

customer_reviews.title: This product is great but it has a design flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice Crock Pot the only thing is, when you use the clips, If one gets caught under the latch and does not go all the way in the hook. It will break the clip. Should have made it so it cannot close unless the clips are in the correct position. Other then that we use it all the time and it works great. Just have to be very careful to make sure the clips are in the right place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: My old Crockpot got broken, so needed a new one. It was time to get some of the newer features that the old one (ancient) did not have. I like the timer feature which works flawlessly. The removable crock is very easy to clean (I use liners which makes cleanup even easier), the stainless steel exterior is also easy to wipe clean. The latching lid is a great feature to avoid car spills when taking it to another location.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but gets very hot
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Crock-Pot brand slow cooker. It works well, and the customer service is second to none. My biggest regret is not getting something with cool touch sides. This thing gets very hot on the outside, much more so than my old GE did. The GE also had a retractable cord for storage that I miss. I much prefer the ceramic crock to the nonstick aluminum in some cookers. I am happy with my purchase, but make sure to keep out of reach of children.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in packaging
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is a gift, so I will update after the holidays. However, since this is a gift, I was very disappointed in the packaging. The box is worn, faded, cracked at the edges, and there is a hole in the center. I don’t have have time to exchange it before the gift exchange, but I am embarrassed to give this to someone. It looks terrible on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Girl

customer_reviews.title: Way to hot
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this 3 weeks ago and have used it twice. There is no difference between the high and low it is just high. Had to put it on warm because it cooks so hot it burns the food. Not very happy so far and I wish we would have gotten the Hamilton beach but I went for the cheaper price and Crock pot name. I do like the locking lid for transport but do not secure it when cooking and leave the lid open a little bit because of the heat being to hot. Hard to clean when food burns on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS VANDERVEEN

customer_reviews.title: Temp controls don't work.
customer_reviews.text: Agreed- waaay too hot. The low temperature does not work, and it boiled the meat -terrible texture. Even "keep warm" was still boiling. Someone at the party said theirs is the same way. Since slow cooked meat was the reason I bought it, I'll donate it rather than lose kitchen space to store it. Back to using my old rather ugly Hamilton Beach one.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Sold on the lock down lid
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because the lid fits very loosely and seems to be a bit off (not exactly the right shape) Have to make sure it’s all aligned right. When it is it seals off fine. Otherwise I’m very happy with it. Not too hot like previous crockpots I’ve had...where even on low they burn around the edges. Only used a couple times so hopefully it keeps working good.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Must have item
customer_reviews.text: Coming up on the two year mark in October and I've used this thing hundreds of times. Drop in chicken, beef, veggies and walk away. I came back to review bc I was telling a friend about it. Yesterday, I threw in about 6 chicken thighs, 32oz of chicken broth, several carrots, bag of frozen stir fry veggies, two roughly sliced tomatoes, and a half bag of spinach. 4+ hours later, it smells great in my kitchen and I have a few days worth of soup. Took less than five minutes to prep.
customer_reviews.author: prepsphere

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Perfect temp on high or low. I bought this specifically for being able to set the hours needed to cook and the keep warm when time is done. My Crock Pot of 30 years finally needed to be replaced, the outer cover separated at the base seem, exposing elec elements. I bought a hamilton beach that lasted <2 years of 2-4X's a month use, terrible! I soooooo appreciate this 6qt CP and features. Lock top for travel is a nice added bonus I most likely will use on occasion. Cleans up easily, I use liner bags. Price point was the best around. Will always stay with Crock Pot brand now.
customer_reviews.author: JB Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my niece who is now in her first apartment. I haven't used a crock pot in a hundred years. I had no idea they still existed. Now it is 21st century high tech. She absolutely loves it and is perfect for her very busy schedule. She does not know how to cook so this wonderful crock pot is a great item to get her started. She will use this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: BlueHeron

customer_reviews.title: Converted crockpot user now
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! I had no idea what I was missing and have no idea why I waited so long to invest in one of these... and yes it’s an investment! An investment in my sanity and time! Love the crockpot and it’s made a lot of dinners easier smoother and created less mess for me. This crockpot is more than big enough to make meals for my daughter and I, and an extra person or two. It’s very very easy to use and self explanatory. Clean up is also super easy. Again..love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I bought this crock pot based on it's good reviews. I am very disappointed because it cooks ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this crock pot based on it's good reviews. I am very disappointed because it cooks way to hot, even on the keep warm setting my food is at a strong boil. I made a recipe that called for cooking on low for 8 hours and my meal was done in 2.
customer_reviews.author: sboen

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT HOLD 6 QUARTS! Only holds 4 quarts of food.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. This is not 6 quarts. Holds just over 4 qts. The box says 6 quarts but clearly that is not the measurement of the stonewall container that holds food. Was on sale so will probably keep it but I was definitely looking for something bigger. Programmable feature is nice and secure lid with handles is great. Just needs to be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for a Trusted Brand!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find this Crock Pot brand slow cooker on sale. I received my first Crock Pot as a Christmas gift in the 70's, and fell in love with slow cooking. Over the years, I've owned other brands of cookers, but I've found Crock Pot to be most reliable and durable. I love THIS model because it's big enough for a large chicken or a turkey breast. I also love the locking cover, which will be handy when we take a potluck contribution in the car.
customer_reviews.author: 2Hands4Him

customer_reviews.title: Shopped around and found this to be the best
customer_reviews.text: Love the locking/sealed lid. Really helps in proper cooking as it almost creates a pressure cooker situation wherein non-locking lids tend to release too much of the heat and moisture while slow cooking. It was a breeze to clean and use. Highly recommend. Found Amazon to be $10 cheaper than brick and mortar options at the time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JeepGuyFL

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Crock-Pot for several years. I loved my last one but it had a frayed electrical cord so I had to buy another one. I purchased this one in hopes it would live up to the expectation of the previous Crock-Pot....It has not. While the outside gets very hot, it takes the inside approximately 3 hours just to heat to a minimal boil. What used to take 5 hours in the old Crock-Pot, now takes almost 8 hours. Unfortunately, I will have to buy another and it may be something other than Crock-Pot if the performance has diminished this much. Unhappy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Crock-Pot SCCPVL610-S-A 6-Quart Cook & Carry Programmable Slow Cooker with Digital Timer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an older Crock-Pot. Have owned for over a year now. Nothing to complain about...has work as expected. Digital timer is nice in case I'm running late after work or running errands. Really like the idea of the locking lid for family/community functions. Standard liner bags fit nicely making clean-up a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mark E. Kalarovich

customer_reviews.title: Bulge in pot part
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the pot yet, because I am afraid to. The pot part has, inside, on the bottom, in the center, near an edge, a raised line in the metal, about 1 inch long. I am afraid the metal will fail. It is impossible to contact customer service to ask if this is to be expected. (My last crockpot had a completely smooth metal bottom inside). If customer service and or other users can answer me that this is normal, and safe, and not metal failing, I will be happy to use it and change my review. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: lb

customer_reviews.title: A slightly hot slow cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this slow cooker in 2015 and have been using it since then. It has always cooked a little ‘hot’ but it’s easy enough to adjust the time to compensate for that. But, 3 years later and it’s gotten hotter. I am repurchasing it today because I was so happy with it for the first 2.8 years of its life!! I recommend this highly!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Bierman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I hate this crockpot. It cooks chicken just fine but will not cook any other kind of meat well. I've tried cooking roasts and round steaks and stew meat and it is always tough, or half will be cooked and half won't. I've even had a problem with potatoes and carrots still being crunchy after cooking for 8 hours! My old crock pot was the same brand and I never had a problem with it so I'm really disappointed. I'm going to have to get a new crock pot soon.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Prpich

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a 15 year old 6-quart Crock Pot, after the stonewear developed a crack, and a replacement wasn't available. I've only used it once, but it slow cooked a pork loin as well as my old one. The electronic controls were an important feature. The locking lid is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Fonebone

customer_reviews.title: Ruins food!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on Amazon right now buying a new one. My roast beef is boiling on the low setting after a couple hours. Great, if I want it to be overcooked and dry (spoiler alert, I do not.) This happens consistently and I'm tired of it so time for a new one. I can't believe I've dealt with this for 3 years! I've uploaded a video. For context, I cooked a roast on Low for 3 hours and 20 minutes. The video is taken after 20 more minutes on the Keep Warm setting
customer_reviews.author: Praha3

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The temperature settings do not work. I was so excited to have a programmable slow-cooker. But after owning this for just over a year I have to say I am completely disappointed! I have ruined so many meals because despite the setting switching to "keep warm" the food continued to cook at a rolling boil 200+ degrees. Essentially I end up unplugging it after the food is done and only plugging it back in as it begins to cool, which totally defeats the purpose of having a slow cooker... If I wanted boiled meat I would have put it on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: D. Endecott

customer_reviews.title: Love the snap on lid
customer_reviews.text: This crockpot was a big upgrade from my last crockpot that my grandmother gave me. It is programable and the fact that the lid snaps shut is great for transporting items to a party or friends house. It is easy to clean since the inside pot comes out. This was just in time for a Chili Cookoff at work.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L Holleman

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of this slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this slow cooker, but the temperature control is very off. The low setting is way too hot and the warm setting actually creates simmer bubbles in liquid. Much prefer my old school “dial” crock pot from the 90’s.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Overheats on Outside
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this unit. I purchased it to replace my old crock-pot. It would get scorching hot on the outside and be barely like warm in the inside. I’m not sure if they put the heating elements on inside out or what. I ended up throwing the unit out after around a month of it sitting unused for fear of fire.
customer_reviews.author: White

customer_reviews.title: This little sucker works pretty darned good
customer_reviews.text: This little sucker works pretty darned good. I didn't know if we'd like the locking lid, but after dragging it around to a couple church pot luck dinners, I'd never use anything else. The timer function is pretty handy too. I'll start a roast on high in the morning and let it run for four hours and then it pops down to 'warm' until the wife and fam are home. Pretty slick.
customer_reviews.author: michael w

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this for a few meals so far. It seems to function very well. Enjoyed my roast, taters, onions and carrots. I think the seal around lid is a little flimsy but I have not had trouble with steam sneaking out around edges. It also arrived packaged well and undamaged in manufacturers packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves this crock pot
customer_reviews.text: Wife Loves this crock pot, and by extension so does my belly. This is the third one i have bought her. The first one i left in another country and it was cheaper to buy another one than go back and get it. The second i was leaving a party, in which my wife had made some amazing meatballs, was fairly drunk and tripped over my own feet, fell and broke it. Crockpot works great, lid locks tight and food is flavorful. I will probably, inevitably, end up buying a 4th one someday when i end up doing something seriously stupid to break or lose this one.
customer_reviews.author: shakka

customer_reviews.title: You'll love this crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my, do I love this crock pot! I still have the old one that has a rotary switch with low and high and off, and doesn't hold nearly as much as this one. I love that I can program the time on this, love the large size, and love the locking top - I made dressing in it for Thanksgiving and took it to my daughter's, so easy! My old one will be going out in the next yard sale. Plus I was able to get it on a Daily Deal so the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Holly AW

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first slow cooker. I chose it after checking reviews all over the internet and comparing features. I don't feel like dealing with a touch screen slow cooker and paying twice the price for it. It's really uneccessary. This has the timer and keep warm feature, plus the locking lid for travel, so I don't need much else. I've made chicken stock overnight and bbq pulled pork in my first few days with the Crock Pot and I'm happy with it. This frees up the oven for bread to go with my pot roasts. I also like not worrying about burning the house down because this is a product that is meant to be left alone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This Crock-pot looks very nice and I really like the locking lid. Their is no difference between Hi and Lo temp setting. It boils the food on both settings. The outside is too hot to touch. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: V Lagneaux

customer_reviews.title: The feet are not long enough to have any real messes if your crockpot is not super full but I still hate working with it
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this item a couple of times, partly due to the "feet" on this thing. There are only 3 feet and therefore is tipsy. The feet are not long enough to have any real messes if your crockpot is not super full but I still hate working with it. Just to even grab one handle to move it one way or another and it tips to that side.
customer_reviews.author: StarLily

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage.... the first time I gently put the clasp on to clamp the lid, It broke...back it goes... can't anyone make a decent product anymore? There is a cheap gasket that prevents the lid from simply testing evenly without gaps into the crockpot... So you have to clamp it....the clamps are dollar tree cheap quality... don't do it...
customer_reviews.author: Luv2bholm

customer_reviews.title: Love the programming features but rubber on lid is wrinkled ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the programming features but rubber on lid is wrinkled and didn't smooth out after first use. May need to contact CrockPot company to request replacement lid. Afraid the air gap didn't keep enough heat in to keep food on top warm after it stopped cooking. Otherwise, works well and not enough issue to necessitate a return at this point.
customer_reviews.author: SM407

customer_reviews.title: Crock of.....
customer_reviews.text: Piece. Of. Crap. First time we used it we made stew. After five hours, the veggies were still hard as it never reached boiling temperature. Today we made beans and hocks and had the same problem. After 7 hours it barely had bubbles on the edge. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This appliance heats evenly and quickly. The locking lid is simply amazing. I can have a crock pot full of soup and travel 10 to 12 miles with it over a bumpy road (we have 4 to 5 miles of dirt roads) and have never spilled one drop. It is easy to clean and is dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: alie16

customer_reviews.title: quick working by the third use
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice and it worked great both of those times. The third time I went to use it, it would not heat at all. No temperature change. And I am past the return window now so I only got to use it twice before it died. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm "Storm"

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, cheaply made - doesn't cook well.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. This was a replacement for a crockpot that I owned for almost a decade. I thought that, if anything, it being a newer generation that it would be even better than it's predecessor. Sadly, I was wrong. The glass cover is cheaply made, the seal is very thin and bottom line... it doesn't cook anything in the time it should. I just took a pork roast out of that had been cooking for over 10 hours and it still wasn't done. In my previous crockpot, the same roast cooked in 8 hours. I gave up after 10 hours and used my InstantPot.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Crockpot Digital Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I Really like This Cooker it is Perfect For Our Family Of Two It's Not To Big Or Too Small It's Just Right I Highly Recommended It Also It's Really Beautiful Appliance 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Elizagail

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first-ever crock-pot that has a timer, and I'm in LOVE. So I have had the same crock-pot for the past 5 years, and my grandma had it for probably 10 years before that. It was just a simple "High, Low, Warm" switch. No digital display. Anyways, I've recently gotten into the whole freezer meal prep movement, and I really needed something that would switch to warm when it was done. So I decided to try this one. It's a lifesaver! I would have preferred the wi-fi crock-pot, but I couldn't possibly justify spending that much money on one. I'll update here if I run into any issues, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Crockpot!
customer_reviews.text: This Crockpot is awesome! The size is great - can easily hold a roast or a whole chicken. The timer function is very convenient to make sure your food doesn't overcook. When the cook time finishes, it automatically switches over to "warm" mode so your food is ready to eat when you get home. You also have the ability to choose between warm & hot cooking. The lid actually clamps down (only for transporting) so it makes it easier to take a hot dish to a potluck.
customer_reviews.author: Renita Perrone

customer_reviews.title: Cooks like a crockpot!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace our 20-year old crockpot. It works great. I like the fact that it automatically switches to "keep warm" after the cooking time ends. We've used it a few times and find that it works just like our old one does. I haven't traveled with it to test the locking lid, but it was good that they had a note inside that said not to lock the lid while you are in cooking mode.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Worst CrockPot ever
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this version of the crock pot. This one overcooks the food. I had a 5-lb eye of round roast set for a 10-hour cook time on low and it was cooked in 4 hours despite the pot being full of liquid. This continuously happens. I need to get rid of this one and buy a different slow cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Lid breaks easly
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take much for the lid to break and shatter and you can not find a lid for it. Crock Pot themselves will not even sell you one when you call. I will not be anything made by Crock Pot again. I went and bought another brand.
customer_reviews.author: John D Powell

customer_reviews.title: Try something else. The temperatures are way off.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old crockpot. I used it on warm to for my already cooked stuffing, after a short while I checked on it and my stuffing was sizzling! On warm! The bottom was burning and I was beyond mad. So back in the box it goes. Returned. But tell me, why is it so hard to find a decent crockpot?
customer_reviews.author: CAmommaT

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job well! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is awesome. I can really fit anything in it, and cook anything in it. It heats up very fast and the low setting is exactly how hot you'd want it to be, not too hot. I've had this for months now and have made all sorts of roasts and soups including bone broth every week (which cooks on low 24 HOURS). Its easy to clean and easy to use I highly recommend this. (Review not sponsored)
customer_reviews.author: Momonkey

customer_reviews.title: as they have a great reputation already in the slow cooking department
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how much there is to write about CrockPot in general, as they have a great reputation already in the slow cooking department. What I can say about this particular CrockPot is that the tight sealing lid and clamp down locks work really well when you need to take your CrockPot to pot-luck dinners. I remember many times as a kid being "in-charge" of making sure the CrockPot didn't tip over in the car for mom and dad. This thing eliminates the hassle/worrying and will stay sealed even if it flips upside-down!
customer_reviews.author: RichardFenoglio

customer_reviews.title: Two Are Better than One
customer_reviews.text: I loved this so much I bought one for my Mom for Mother's Day. I also bought the Slow Cooker Revolution cookbook. She has been cooking away happily. There are more expensive ones and cheaper ones. This is a very good middle of the road. Deciding features were the heating choice where it will bump to Warm when Set Time is expired and the travel easy lid. My favorite things to make in it are corned beef and cabbage; country pork ribs; my world famous chicken soup; my gourmet jambalaya; beef stew; Irish bangers and ramps.
customer_reviews.author: SD Webgal

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with how the crockpot works although I agree it ...
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with how the crockpot works although I agree it cooks to fast. But after owning the product for less than 1 year we have had to contact them already twice for a crack in the inner pot. The first time was in April - they were nice and send us a new pot very fast. Now 5 months later there is a crack again in the replacement pot. We never put it in the dishwasher, use the liner bags, mainly use it on low and then go to warm. It doesn't get moved or dropped. I think there is a quality issue here. I would not recommend buying this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Weymans

customer_reviews.title: Love this Crock Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I did extensive research before buying this crock pot. I have another manual slow cooker by Kitchenaid which is 7 qts and very heavy, very hard to clean, and always seems to dry out food. I got this crock pot the other night and made my first meal in it. The programmable option was great and when it switched to the warm setting, did not over-dry the food. In fact, the chicken was so tender it shredded apart without any effort and the meal was wonderful. The unit is also much lighter weight and easier to clean and transport. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ricasuave78

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much, we bought a second one!
customer_reviews.text: It is our second time buying this crockpot. (Needed a second to cook a week’s worth of healthy food on the weekend).
customer_reviews.author: ABR

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought this one!!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this product and use it often. This is just what I needed to make dinners for 2-4 people. It’s so easy to use and so easy to clean. I have an instant pot sitting in the box brand new because my slow cooker does the trick every time... and I don’t have to worry about blowing my face off.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Good, but Limited Programming Options
customer_reviews.text: The finish on this is fine; the insert is hefty and holds heat well. Biggest issue for me is that "programmable" is misleading; you can't set this to run on high for an hour, and then change temp. It's programming is High/Low/Keep Warm, and for how long. So if you need a model that can do more complicated cooking directions, keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Davis

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with this Crock-Pot. Upon taking it out of the box, I noticed that the Crock-Pot looked smudged with finger prints and the control panel looked used. Also, the cooking basin seemed rather small. It moved around quite a lot in the base, which is something I've never experienced with other slow cookers I've owned, and when I showed my mother and sister-in-law how unstable it was they thought that was not right either. Cooking with it wasn't horrible, but it did seem to run pretty hot. I had cooked something on high for 2 hours and then set it to warm and it just continued to boil. So, needless to say, I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: H. Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older crockpot I had for years. It took me a long time to try and figure out what kind I wanted. I am pleased I decided on this model. Works great and the price wasn’t bad. I only hope this one lasts years also.
customer_reviews.author: Namiko Howard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for this family on the go
customer_reviews.text: For the family of 6, this works perfectly! It was purchased as a gift and she and the kids were all excited about the settings it has. They had another 6 qt crockpot with just a low/high feature. She has 1 girl in HS, 1 boy and 2 girls in middle school and 1 girl in elementary. They all (including the elementary girl.. 4th grade) all started looking up recipes they could try making for the family. Perfect gift for this family on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Shadalee

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was a good idea at first
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was a good idea at first, but then used it to keep something warm for a dinner party and it burnt everything. The keep warm setting runs hotter then the hot setting. Wouldn't buy an electronic control one again
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Besides broken lid clamps, slow cooker is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice slow cooker. Although I purchased it over 6 months ago, I recently unpacked and used it for the first time yesterday. I made lasagna and it was delicious. Just a note of caution, open product when it arrives even if you don’t immediately plan to use. My lid clamps were broken when I finally opened the box to use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Parker

customer_reviews.title: When this went on super sale for Prime Day I decided to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We had a more basic Crock-Pot from Costco that we used for years. It did okay but often scorched the foods if you didn't get the timing right and it was always a pain to clean--plus everything got sort of a one-note flavor. It was odd and not in keeping with the rave reviews for slow cookers that I'd seen elsewhere. When this went on super sale for Prime Day I decided to upgrade. This is great! We have not had any problems with scorching and the same recipes we've made before are better because of the better temperature control. Best of all, cleaning is easy. Very good quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Marcilla P

customer_reviews.title: I have always been very pleased with my older crock-pots
customer_reviews.text: We are on our 3rd stone insert which still doesn't fit. Removing stone insert with hot food is almost impossible as no sides to hold on to to lift out. The locking lid is very hard to lock with out causing burns when unit is cooking. I am so sorry I bought this crock-pot, I thought crock-pot would keep it standards high. I cooked beef stew for 9 hours and potatoes were still not done. I have always been very pleased with my older crock-pots..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 Great Reasons to Use a Crock Pot
customer_reviews.text: I am finding that you often have to brown foods in another pan before hand - to get that "flavor." So what is the point? A slow cooker is really good for 3 main reasons: breaking down/ tenderizing meats in a dish, having something ready (hot) to eat right when you get home from a long day, or to take to a party and having it be warm. All great reasons to own a slow cooker. Everything else could be done better in an oven or a pot. This is Crock-Pot is very simply to use and made well. This Crock-Pot holds enough for 8 - 12 servings. I usually make 8 servings (eat 4, freeze 4)
customer_reviews.author: AnaBanana

customer_reviews.title: It's a shame because otherwise this would be a real nice slow cooker but now
customer_reviews.text: This crock pot has 3 temperature settings: high, low, and warm. I put 3 inches of water in the crock pot and all three settings read 209 degrees. I left it on each setting for over an hour. Now, of course, I've discarded the box so I can't return it. It's a shame because otherwise this would be a real nice slow cooker but now, knowing this wiring is messed up, I can't trust it. I don't want it to burn my house down. Until now I've had excellent results from the Crock Pot brand so maybe this is just a fluke but I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Grall

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should a crockpot
customer_reviews.text: Already have this one. Sent to my niece so she can learn to cook easy meals without fuss.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wlodarek

product_meta.title: Crock-Pot SCCPVL610-S-A 6-Quart Cook & Carry Programmable Slow Cooker with Digital Timer, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelThe Crock Pot Programmable Cook & Carry Slow Cooker with Digital Timer is made for portability. Its secure locking lid and rubber gasket create an airtight seal, helping to prevent spills on the road food stays inside, and you arrive at your destination without any worry or mess. Bring this portable slow cooker to potlucks, family gatherings, tailgating, parties and more. The digital panel allows you to customize your cooking time between 30 minutes and 20 hours, and set the temperature on High, Low, and and Warm. After cooking is complete, the slow cooker will automatically shift to Warm for up to 6 hours to help maintain food temperature and flavor. With dishwasher safe components, this is the perfect digital slow cooker just about anytime you need to transport food prepared at home. Recipes included. Weight: 16.18 Pounds,Cord length: 24 inch.
feature_bullets: 6 quart Cook & Carry Slow Cooker serves 7+ people
Digital countdown control lets you program cook times anywhere from 30 minutes up to 20 hours; shifts to Warm setting automatically once cook time completes
Easy to use locking lid featuring lid gasket provides extra seal for less mess on the go

All Crock Pot Slow Cooker removable stone inserts (without lid) may be used safely in the microwave and the oven set up to 400 degree F; If you own another slow cooker brand, please refer to your owner’s manual for specific crockery cooking medium tolerances
Works on 240 Watts at 120V A.C; and 60Hz

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,517 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
